channel.title: RS2 194 Items, NPCs, and Objects viewer
channel.description:
In order to better understand Jagex's 3D engine, I've developed an items, npcs, and objects viewer. It's for the 194 client because I'm currently refactoring it, etc.
Here are the controls: -Up arrow: translates model upward -Down arrow: translates model downward -Left arrow: translates model leftward -Right arrow: translates model rightward -Mouse drag: rotates model -Mouse left click: decreases opacity -Mouse right click: increases opacity -Page up: brightens the 3d canvas -Page down: darkens the 3d canvas -Mouse wheel: zooms in/out -F1: loads specified item by id -F2: loads specified npc by id -F3: loads specified object by id -F4: toggles help message which says all of this anyway -F5: opens up items, npc, and object lists
Pictures of program usage:
[b]Loading an item:[/b] [img]http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/mviewer_items.png[/img]
[b]Loading a npc:[/b] [img]http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/mviewer_npcs.png[/img]
[b]Loading an object:[/b] [img]http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/mviewer_objects.png[/img]
[url=http://ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/viewer194.jar]Download link[/url]
Known issues: Rotation is a bit... distorted. I really haven't figured out what the 4 rotation values are specifically used for, but I have tested each individually and have guessed. The way they are modified based on mouse movement could be modified easily. What I did works fine, but not perfectly. Another issue is that some of the objects won't load. This is simply from how I am building their models. This could be fixed in a future release, but really isn't too important.
Post any questions you have.
Edit: Before, if you loaded up an object that needed a texture (ie, a create), the texture wouldn't show up unless you changed the brightness. This has been fixed.

item.title: RS2 194 Items, NPCs, and Objects viewer
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

[quote=“Tekk123, post:1, topic:292012”]I’m trying to get a RS 194 server started (from scratch) or at least the client working.

I’ve downloaded the client and cache from the sticky and put the cache files in a “.file_store_32” folder but all I get when trying to run is “Error loading - retrying in 5 secs.”

I’ve decompiled the client and looked in signlink.java and AFAIK it’s looking in the right place for the cache.

I realize this post sounds sort of noobish but I do have knowledge of Java and what’s going on.

Can someone help me?[/quote]
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 194 Items, NPCs, and Objects viewer
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

In order to better understand Jagex’s 3D engine, I’ve developed an items, npcs, and objects viewer. It’s for the 194 client because I’m currently refactoring it, etc.

Here are the controls:
-Up arrow: translates model upward
-Down arrow: translates model downward
-Left arrow: translates model leftward
-Right arrow: translates model rightward
-Mouse drag: rotates model
-Mouse left click: decreases opacity
-Mouse right click: increases opacity
-Page up: brightens the 3d canvas
-Page down: darkens the 3d canvas
-Mouse wheel: zooms in/out
-F1: loads specified item by id
-F2: loads specified npc by id
-F3: loads specified object by id
-F4: toggles help message which says all of this anyway
-F5: opens up items, npc, and object lists

Pictures of program usage:

Loading an item:

Loading a npc:

Loading an object:

Download link

Known issues: Rotation is a bit… distorted. I really haven’t figured out what the 4 rotation values are specifically used for, but I have tested each individually and have guessed. The way they are modified based on mouse movement could be modified easily. What I did works fine, but not perfectly. Another issue is that some of the objects won’t load. This is simply from how I am building their models. This could be fixed in a future release, but really isn’t too important.

Post any questions you have.

Edit: Before, if you loaded up an object that needed a texture (ie, a create), the texture wouldn’t show up unless you changed the brightness. This has been fixed.
